required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open-Label Extension Study to Evaluate Long Term Safety and Treatment Effect of DiaPep277®
clinical_study.official_title: Open-Label Study to Evaluate Long Term Safety and Treatment Effect of DiaPep277® in Subjects Who Have Completed Study 1001 (NCT01103284)

brief_summary.textblock: This is an extension study to evaluate the safety and tolerability of long-term treatment with DiaPep277® and to determine the long-term treatment effect of DiaPep277® on parameters of metabolic control and on preservation of beta-cell function in subjects who have long exposure to DiaPep277®.

detailed_description.textblock:
Treatment with DiaPep277® is expected to be long-term; stopping treatment may result in the eventual loss of the preserved beta-cell function. Indeed, extension of phase 2 studies has shown that patients who were initially treated with DiaPep277® and maintained their initial beta-cell function, required continuation of treatment, losing beta-cell function if switched to Placebo. These extension studies were too small for the outcome to be statistically significant, but they suggested that continuation of treatment is needed for long-term maintenance of efficacy.
Therefore, in this extension study, patients who complete the 1001 phase 3 study (NCT01103284) and maintain clinically significant beta-cell function are offered a 2-year continuation of active treatment, since they are likely to benefit from use of the medication. The participation in the extension study will be offered to all eligible subjects who complete the 1001 study, regardless of the treatment arm allocation in the initial study.
By achieving long-term preservation of beta-cell function, patients are expected to maintain good management of the disease, manifesting as better glycemic control and fewer hypoglycemic events.

clinical_study.why_stopped: A corporate decision to suspend development of DiaPep277®

primary_outcome.time_frame: At Early Termination Visit, Up to 25 Months
primary_outcome.description: The number of hypoglycemic events recorded by each patient over the course of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Glucagon-stimulated C-peptide AUC at Early Termination Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Early Termination Visit, Up to 25 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Beta-cell function, measured as change in stimulated C-peptide secretion measured 0, 2, 6, 10 and 20 minutes post administration [area under the curve (AUC), 0-20 minutes] at Baseline and the early termination visit (up to 25 months), during a glucagon stimulation test (GST). Change was calculated for each patient by subtracting the baseline AUC value (defined as the last non-missing assessment prior to first dose in the 1010 study but after the end of study 1001) from the early termination visit AUC.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Daily Insulin Dose, Per kg Body Weight, at Early Termination Visit
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Early Termination Visit, up to 25 months

other_outcome.measure: Glycemic Control (Change From Baseline in % HbA1c)
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Early Termination Visit, Up to 25 Months

arm_group.description: Administration of DiaPep277® to patients previously enrolled in the Phase 3 Study 1001 (NCT01103284)

intervention.description: 1 mg of DiaPep277® subcutaneously in the upper arm at 0, 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, and 21 months, for a total of 8 administrations

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with type 1 diabetes who participated in the 1001 study
- residual beta-cell function demonstrated by stimulated C-peptide ≥ 0.20 nmol/L.
Exclusion Criteria:
- The subject has any significant ongoing diseases or conditions that is likely to affect the subject's response to treatment
- The subject has a history of any kind of malignant tumor.
- The subject has clinical evidence of any diabetes-related complication
- Subject has history of endogenous allergic reactivity:
- The subject has a known immune deficiency

facility.name: Henry Ford Medical Centers - New Center One

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients diagnosed with Type 1 diabetes mellitus up to six months before randomization to Study 1001 (NCT01103284), from medical sites in the EU, US, Russia, and Israel

group.title: Patients Treated With DiaPep (Originally Enrolled in Study1001
group.description: All patients enrolled in the 1010 study (NCT01898286), whether previously treated with DiaPep277 or placebo in the 1001 study (NCT01103284).

participants_list.participants: For this study "completed" is defined as completing the Early Termination visit

group.title: Patients Treated With DiaPep (Originally Enrolled in Study1001
group.description: All patients enrolled in the 1010 study (NCT01898286), whether previously treated with DiaPep277 or placebo in the 1001 study (NCT01103284).

outcome.title: Hypoglycemic Events
outcome.description: The number of hypoglycemic events recorded by each patient over the course of the study.
outcome.time_frame: At Early Termination Visit, Up to 25 Months
outcome.population: Patients with hypoglycemic event data at the time of their early termination visit. This population is smaller than the population numbers in the patient flow categories because not all patients were willing to provide information on hypoglycemic events at early termination.

group.title: Patients Treated With DiaPep (Originally Enrolled in Study1001
group.description: All patients enrolled in the 1010 study (NCT01898286), whether previously treated with DiaPep277 or placebo in the 1001 study (NCT01103284).

measure.title: Hypoglycemic Events
measure.description: The number of hypoglycemic events recorded by each patient over the course of the study.
measure.population: Patients with hypoglycemic event data at the time of their early termination visit. This population is smaller than the population numbers in the patient flow categories because not all patients were willing to provide information on hypoglycemic events at early termination.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Glucagon-stimulated C-peptide AUC at Early Termination Visit
outcome.description: Beta-cell function, measured as change in stimulated C-peptide secretion measured 0, 2, 6, 10 and 20 minutes post administration [area under the curve (AUC), 0-20 minutes] at Baseline and the early termination visit (up to 25 months), during a glucagon stimulation test (GST). Change was calculated for each patient by subtracting the baseline AUC value (defined as the last non-missing assessment prior to first dose in the 1010 study but after the end of study 1001) from the early termination visit AUC.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Early Termination Visit, Up to 25 Months
outcome.population: Only 9 patients had sufficient data for this analysis, as many patients declined to undergo the GST at the termination visit.

group.title: Patients Treated With DiaPep (Originally Enrolled in Study1001
group.description: All patients enrolled in the 1010 study (NCT01898286), whether previously treated with DiaPep277 or placebo in the 1001 study (NCT01103284).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Glucagon-stimulated C-peptide AUC at Early Termination Visit
measure.description: Beta-cell function, measured as change in stimulated C-peptide secretion measured 0, 2, 6, 10 and 20 minutes post administration [area under the curve (AUC), 0-20 minutes] at Baseline and the early termination visit (up to 25 months), during a glucagon stimulation test (GST). Change was calculated for each patient by subtracting the baseline AUC value (defined as the last non-missing assessment prior to first dose in the 1010 study but after the end of study 1001) from the early termination visit AUC.
measure.population: Only 9 patients had sufficient data for this analysis, as many patients declined to undergo the GST at the termination visit.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Daily Insulin Dose, Per kg Body Weight, at Early Termination Visit
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Early Termination Visit, up to 25 months
outcome.population: All patients with daily insulin dose data at baseline and their early termination visit. Only 11 patients could be included in this analysis, as not all patients provided insulin dose data at their early termination visit.

group.title: Patients Treated With DiaPep (Originally Enrolled in Study1001
group.description: All patients enrolled in the 1010 study (NCT01898286), whether previously treated with DiaPep277 or placebo in the 1001 study (NCT01103284).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Daily Insulin Dose, Per kg Body Weight, at Early Termination Visit
measure.population: All patients with daily insulin dose data at baseline and their early termination visit. Only 11 patients could be included in this analysis, as not all patients provided insulin dose data at their early termination visit.

outcome.title: Glycemic Control (Change From Baseline in % HbA1c)
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Early Termination Visit, Up to 25 Months
outcome.population: All patients with % HbA1c data at baseline and their early termination visit. Only 5 patients were available for this analysis, as not all patients agreed to complete HbA1c testing at the early termination visit.

group.title: Patients Treated With DiaPep (Originally Enrolled in Study1001
group.description: All patients enrolled in the 1010 study (NCT01898286), whether previously treated with DiaPep277 or placebo in the 1001 study (NCT01103284).

measure.title: Glycemic Control (Change From Baseline in % HbA1c)
measure.population: All patients with % HbA1c data at baseline and their early termination visit. Only 5 patients were available for this analysis, as not all patients agreed to complete HbA1c testing at the early termination visit.

reported_events.time_frame: AE data were collected from the time of subject enrollment through each subject's early termination visit

group.title: Patients Treated With DiaPep (Originally Enrolled in Study1001
group.description: All patients enrolled in the 1010 study (NCT01898286), whether previously treated with DiaPep277 or placebo in the 1001 study (NCT01103284).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Investigator shall submit any paper or presentation to the Sponsor for review and comments at least 60 days prior to submitting the same to a third party. Upon receiving any request from the Sponsor to delete any Confidential Information or request to delay in publication up to 90 days to allow the filing of any Sponsor application, the Investigator shall take the request action. Investigator shall not be restricted after 18 months from completion of their site's performance in the study.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The objectives of this study were to evaluate the safety and tolerability of long term treatment with DiaPep277. The study was terminated by the Sponsor on 08Sep14; hence many of the protocol-specified objectives could not be adequately assessed
